result.execSummary:
The defendant Levana M. Irving was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Levana M. Irving is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Levana M. Irving was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
May not have contact with victim, unless otherwise permitted by the agent.  DOC shall promptly notify the court of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.

4/26/17 - Sentencing Hearing

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Mary Losey.  Victim rights compliance.  Sentencing arguments made.  Deft sentenced to 5yrs WSP; initial confinement of 1yr followed by 4yrs of ES.  ES conditions to be identical to those of probation unless already satisfied.  In addition, Court orders the deft not to have any contact with any of the individuals involved in any of her episodes/violations.  Credit for 206 days.  Deft not eligible for CIP or SAP.  Appeal rights.
Atty Mary Losey
Sentencing hearing on revocation on April 26, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Sentencing hearing on April 23, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Everett King.  Case is resolved.  Deft pleads guilty to count 1; found guilty by the Court.  Remaining counts are dismissed on State's motion.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 4/15/15 @ 3pm.  Arguments heard on deft's bond motion.  State objects to the bond reduction.  Deft's bond motion is denied.  Bond to continue as presently fixed.
for Bond Modification - filed by Atty King

Everett King

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Everett King. Clerk LE.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 3. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 3-4-14 @ 9:20am. Jury selection on 3-23-15 @ 9:00am with co-def. Bond continued.
to Preliminary Hearing

203 p.m.  Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney E King.  Clk  LE.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on 12/10/14 @ 930 a.m.  Atty King moves to dismiss Ct 4 - Court denies motino.   $2500 Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).
